raw_text: For both tasks the reordering was performed as a preprocessing step using POS information from the TreeTagger (Schmid, 1994) for German and using the Amira Tagger (Diab, 2009) for Arabic
clean_text: For both tasks the reordering was performed as a preprocessing step using POS information from the TreeTagger (Schmid, 1994) for German and using the Amira Tagger (Diab, 2009) for Arabic.

raw_text: In the data-driven approach, the model is automatically generated from annotated text corpora, and the model can be represented e.g. as n-grams (Garside t al., 1987), local rules (Hindle, 1989) or neural nets (Schmid, 1994)

citing_paper_authors: Takaki, Makino | Minoru, Yoshida | Kentaro, Torisawa | Jun'ichi, Tsujii
raw_text: Several kinds of POS taggers using rule-based (e.g., Brill et al, 1990), statistical (e.g., Merialdo, 1994), memory-based (e.g., Daelemans, 1996), and neural network (e.g., Schmid, 1994) models have been proposed for some languages

citing_paper_authors: Takaki, Makino | Minoru, Yoshida | Kentaro, Torisawa | Jun'ichi, Tsujii
raw_text: The correct rate of tagging of these models has reached 95%, in part by using a very large amount of training data (e.g., 1,000,000 words in Schmid, 1994)
clean_text: The correct rate of tagging of these models has reached 95%, in part by using a very large amount of training data (e.g., 1,000,000 words in Schmid, 1994).

citing_paper_authors: Takaki, Makino | Minoru, Yoshida | Kentaro, Torisawa | Jun'ichi, Tsujii
raw_text: Thatneuro models require few parameters may offer another advantage: their performance is less affected by a small amount of training data than that of the statistical methods (Schmid, 1994)

Since the advent of manually tagged corpora such as the Brown Corpus and the Penn Treebank (Francis (1982), Marcus (1993)), the efficacy of machine learning for training a tagger has been demonstrated using a wide array of techniques, including: Markov models, decision trees ,connectionist machines, transformations, nearest-neighbor algorithms, and maximum entropy (Weischedel (1993), Black (1992), Schmid (1994), Brill (1995), Daelemans (1995), Ratnaparkhi (1996))
A statistical-based suffix learner is presented in (Schmid, 1994)
clean_text: A statistical-based suffix learner is presented in (Schmid, 1994).

citing_paper_authors: Smriti, Singh | Kuhoo, Gupta | Manish, Shrivastava | Pushpak, Bhattacharyya
raw_text: The common choice for disambiguation rule learning in POS tagging task is usually ma chine learning techniques mainly focussing on decision tree based algorithms (Orphanos and Christodoulalds, 1999), neural networks (Schmid, 1994), etc. Among the various decision tree based algorithms like ID3, AQR, ASSIS TANT and CN2, CN2 is known to perform better than the rest (Clark and Niblett, 1989)
The TreeTagger showed an accuracy of 96.06% (Schmid, 1994a)
clean_text: The TreeTagger showed an accuracy of 96.06% (Schmid, 1994a).
